reasoning: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia (primarily 21-hydroxylase deficiency) incidence approximately 1-2 per 100k live births. Reported as incidence for this genetic condition with clear diagnosis at birth.
source: Pang SY et al. (2005). Worldwide experience in newborn screening for classical congenital adrenal hyperplasia. J Inherit Metab Dis. 25(4):255-266
